column1: special tribunal is showing that crime does not pay vukuzenzele unnamed during the recent presidential imbizo in mahikeng, several citizens raised concerns about the pace of the fight against corruption.
column2: lekgotlana le ikgethileng le bontsha hore bonokwane ha bo na molemo allison cooper pitsong ya mopre sidente e sa tswa tshwarelwa mahikeng, setjhaba se ile sa tletleba ka monyebe oo letsholo la twantsho ya bonokwane le tsamayang ka ona.

column1: they told me what i have heard in many other communities across the country: that the perpetrators of such acts are known, not least because they flaunt the proceeds of their crimes.
column2: ba mpole lletse seo ke seng ke se utlwileng dibakeng tse ngata tseo ke seng ke fetile ho tsona ho phatlalla le naha: dinokwane di a tsejwa hobane ha ba pate ketso tsena tsa tsona.

column1: but the arm of the law is long.
column2: leha ho le jwalo, molao o fihlella hohle.

column1: those who have stolen from the state may believe they have gotten away with it.
column2: bohle ba utsweditseng mmuso, ba se ithetse ba nahane hore ba pholohile.

column1: but their deeds will eventually catch up with them, whoever they are, and whatever position they may hold.
column2: ba tlameha ho tseba hore diketso tsa bona di tla ba latella, ho sa natsehe hore ke bomang, le hore ba maemong a feng.

column1: they will learn that crime does not pay.
column2: ba tla lemoha hore bonokwane ha bo na molemo.

column1: in this regard, one of our most effective weapons in the fight against corruption and state capture is the special tribunal of the special investigating unit (siu), which i established in 2019. it adjudicates on matters that the siu institutes for civil litigation after it has concluded its investigations.
column2: tabeng ena, sebetsa se tla re thusa ho lwantsha bobodu mmoho le kgapo ya puso, ke lekgotlana le ikgethileng la lekala le ikgethileng la mafokisi (siu), le thehilweng ka 2019. lona le shebana le dinyewe tse tswang ho siu ha e se e phethetse diphuputso tsa yona.

column1: the special tribunal was set up to speed up litigation.
column2: lekgotlana lena le ikgethileng, le ne le thehelwe ho potlakisa diqoso tsa bobodu.

column1: this approach has made it possible for public funds and state assets lost to corrupt acts to be recovered faster, avoiding delays in the high courts, where the siu has to wait its turn together with other litigants.
column2: mohato ona o potlakisa taba ya ho kgutliswa ha tjhelete le thepa ya mmuso tse lahlehang ka lebaka la bobodu mme hape le thusa ho qoba tiehiso ya diqoso makgotleng a tlwaelehileng a dinyewe moo siu le yona e tlamehang ho emela letsatsi la nyewe jwalo ka motho ohle.

column1: the siu can request preservation orders and the freezing of assets to prevent further losses to the state.
column2: siu e ka kgona ho kenya kopo ya ho thibela ho fetolwa ha dintho mmoho le ho hapuwa ha thepa ho etsetsa hore mmuso o se tswele pele le ho lahlehelwa.

column1: this is important when considering that per petrators who are under suspicion often go to great lengths to move around, hide or dispose of proceeds of corruption.
column2: sena se thusa haholo ha dinokwane di ka leka ho pata bopaki ba mehlala ya diketso tsa tsona tsa bobodu.

column1: there can be no doubt the special tribunal has been a game changer.
column2: ntle le qeaqeo, lekgo tlana lena le ikgethileng le tlisitse diphetoho.

column1: since its establishment, the tribunal has recovered around r8.6 billion from unlawful contracts.
column2: haesale le thehilwe, le se le kgonne ho kgutlisa tjhelete e fetang dibilione tse 8.6 tsa diranta ho tswa dikonterakeng tse neng di se molaong.

column1: for any fight against corruption to be deemed effective, it is not sufficient that perpetrators are pro secuted.
column2: katleho ya twantsho ya bobodu ha e a tlameha ho fella feela ha baetsi ba bona ba qoswa, empa tseo ba di utswitseng di tla tlameha ho fumaneha.

column1: the proceeds of their crimes must be recovered.
column2: tjhelete ena ke ya setjhaba, mme e tlameha ho sebedisetswa molemong wa sona.

column1: this money belongs to citizens and should be used to meet their needs.
column2: hona jwale, lekgotlana lena le ikgethileng le sa tswa laela dikhamphane tse pedi tsa kaho ho kgutlisa phaello eo di e unneng konterakeng tse neng di se molaong tsa ho teratela ledibohong la beit bridge.

column1: the special tribunal recently ordered two construction companies to return the profits they earned from r40 million in contracts to erect the beit bridge border fence.
column2: sena se latela diphuputso tsa siu tse utullutseng tse ngata tse kenyelletsang ho lefuwa ha dikhamphane pele di etsa mosebetsi ke lefapha la mesebetsi ya mmuso le meralo ya motheo.

column1: this followed an investigation by the siu that uncovered a number of irregularities, including a prepayment to the companies by the department of public works and infrastructure.
column2: dibekeng tse mmalwa tse fetileng feela, lekgotlana lena le se le lekotse botjha mme la behella ka thoko dikonteraka tse neng di se molaong tse mabapi le covid tse bitsang ka hodimo ho dimilione tse 100 tsa diranta.

column1: over the past few weeks alone, the tribunal has reviewed and set aside more than r100 million worth of irregular and unlawful contracts arising from covidrelated pro curement.
column2: lekgotlana lena le ikgethileng, le boetse la atleha ho kgutlisa tjhelete ho tswa ho batsamaisi ba ka sehloohong ba dikhamphane tsa mmuso ba neng ba etsa diketso tsa bolotsana.

column1: the special tribunal has also been successful in getting back money from senior executives in stateowned enterprises who conducted irregular business activities.
column2: mohlala, ngwahola e mong wa batsamaisi ba mehleng ba transnet o ile a laelwa ho kgutlisa dimilione tse 26 tsa diranta tseo a neng a di fumane jwalo ka monga diabo khamphaneng ya dienjiniere e neng e sebedisana le transnet nakong eo yena e sa leng mosebeletsi wa transnet.

column1: for example, last year a former transnet executive was ordered to pay r26 million he received as a shareholder of a firm of consulting engineers contracted to transnet while he was a fulltime employee.
column2: siu e se e kopile lekgo tlana lena makgetlo a mangata ho emisa hanyane ho lefuwa ha ditjhelete tsa penshene tsa basebeletsi ba mmuso ba amehang diketsahalong tsa tshebediso e bohlaswa le e sa nepahalang ya ditjhelete ho fihlela diphuputso tsa bona di fela.

column1: the siu has in a number of cases approached the tribunal to delay the payment of pension benefits, pending the outcome of its investigations, to public servants implicated in financial irregularities or fruitless and wasteful expenditure.
column2: lenane la dinyewe tse ho lekgotlana lena le ikgethileng, di bontsha hore mosebetsi o sa le moholo wa ho netefatsa tshebetso e ntle makaleng ohle a mmuso.

column1: the cases before the special tribunal show that much work still needs to be done to strengthen governance and management across all arms of the state.
column2: ho dinyewe tsena ba fumana tshebetso e bohlaswa ho basebeletsi ba ditjhelete ba sa ikamahanyeng le melawana ya theko ya thepa ya mmuso.

column1: they point to serious lapses on the part of accounting officers and failures to adhere to laws and regulations governing procurement i have said before that winning the war on cor ruption will be difficult, and that it will take time to unravel the vast webs of patronage that had become entrenched.
column2: ke ile ka bolela hore ntwa kgahlano le bobodu ha se eo re ka e hlolang ha bobebe, ho tla nka nako ho rarolla pharela ena ya bona.

column1: i have also maintained that we must fight private sector corruption with equal vigour, because for every public sector employee willing to be bribed, there is a business person willing to pay a bribe.
column2: ke boetse ka bolela hore re tla tlameha hape ho lwantsha le bobodu le dikhampaneng tse ikemetseng ka tsela e tshwanang hobane ha mosebeletsi wa mmuso a batla tjotjo, ho ba le motho ya batlang ho etsa kgwebo le mmuso ya tlang ho lefa tjotjo eo.

column1: these corrupt relationships have eroded the capacity of the state to deliver on its mandate.
column2: bobodu bona bo etsa hore mmuso o se kgone ho etsa seo o tlameha ho se etsa.

column1: they have set back the state’s efforts to provide decent healthcare, to deliver clean water, and to ensure a consistent supply of power to communities and businesses.
column2: diketso tsena di etsa hore mmuso o hlolehe ho fana ka ditshebeletso tse nepahetseng tsa bophelo bo botle, ho fana ka metsi a hlwekileng le phepelo e otlolohileng ya motlakase setjhabeng le dikgwebong.

column1: but, as the special tribunal has demonstrated, we are steadily turning the tide.
column2: leha ho le jwalo, lekgo tlana lena le ikgethang, le fetola mawa.

column1: not only are perpetrators being arrested and taken to court; they are also having to forfeit the proceeds of their crimes.
column2: baetsi bana ba bobe ha ba qetelle feela ka ho tshwarwa ba qoswe, empa ba boela ba amohuwa meputso eo ba e unneng diketsong tseo tsa bona tsa bolotsana.

column1: there is still a long way to go, and there is a huge amount of stolen public funds that still need to be recovered.
column2: ho sa le hole moo re yang mme e ngata le tjhelete ya setjhaba e tlamehang ho kgutla.

column1: but the siu and the special tribunal have made a good start, and i am confident of many more successes in the months and years ahead.
column2: siu le lekgotlana lena le ikgethileng di se di entse moralo o motle, mme ke a tshepa re tla bona tse fetang tsena dikgweding le dilemong tse tlang.

column1: food at school ensures children don’t go hungry vukuzenzele unnamed over nine million children receive a nutritious meal at school thanks to government’s national school nutrition programme (nsnp), which was introduced in 1994. the programme aims to improve children’s ability to learn, by reducing malnutrition and hunger and improving school attendance, especially at disadvantaged schools.
column2: phepo e ntle ya dijo dikolong e netefatsa hore bana ha ba lape vukuzenzele unnamed bana ba fetang milioni tse robong ba fumana dijo tse nang le phepo e ntle sekolong ka diteboho ho lenaneo la naha la phepo e ntle la dikolo (nsnp), le ileng la thakgolwa ka 1994. lenaneo lena le ikemiseditse ho ntlafatsa bokgoni ba bana ba ho ithuta, ka ho fokatsa kgaello ya phepo e ntle, tlala le ho ntlafatsa palo ya bana ba tlang sekolong, haholoholo ba dikolong tse hlokang menyetla.

column1: "the programme is critical for furthering learners’ constitutional rights to basic nutrition and basic education," explains deputy minister of basic education dr reginah mhaule.
column2: "lenaneo lena le bohlokwahlokwa bakeng sa ho ntshetsapele ditokelo tsa baithuti tsa molaotheo tsa phepo e ntle le thuto ya motheo," ho hlalosa motlatsi wa letona la thuto ya motheo, ngaka reginah mhaule.

column1: as a result of the nsnp, more children are attending school on time and more regularly, and their concentration in class has improved.
column2: ka lebaka la nsnp, boholo ba bana ba fihla sekolong ka nako le ho tla sekolong kgafetsa, mme le ho mamela ka hloko ha bona ka phaphosing ya borutelo ho ntlafetse.

column1: according to the department of basic education (dbe), learners are taught good eating and lifestyle habits.
column2: ho ya ka lefapha la thuto ya motheo (dbe), baithuti ba rutwa mekgwa e metle ya ho ja dijo tse matlafatsang mmele le ditsela tse ntle tsa mokgwa wa ho phela.

column1: schools are also encouraged to set up their own food gardens to supplement the nsnp menu.
column2: dikolo di kgothaletswa ho lema dirapa tsa tsona tsa dijo ho tlatseletsa lenane la dijo tsa nsnp.

column1: learners, teachers and parents are taught grow their own food.
column2: baithuti, matitjhere le batswadi ba rutwa ho itemela dijo.

column1: nsnp awards thabang primary school in bethlehem, free state, is one of the schools that benefits from the nsnp.
column2: dikgao tsa nsnp sekolo sa thabang primary se bethlehem, freistata, ke se seng sa dikolo tse unang moleng ho nsnp.

column1: the school recently won the nsnp best school award.
column2: haufinyane se ile sa hapa kgao ya sekolo se hlwahlwa sa nsnp.

column1: the awards celebrate schools’ nutrition programmes by looking at their hygiene and safety practices, nutritious meals, food gardens and nutrition education.
column2: dikgao di ne di keteka mananeo a dikolo a phepo e ntle ka ho sheba ditlwaelo tsa tsona tsa bohlweki le boitshireletsi, dijo tse nang le phepo e ntle, dirapa tsa dijo le thuto ya phepo e ntle.

column1: "i am extremely grateful that the school won the award," says seyanokeng sejake, the thabang pri mary principal for the past 24 years.
column2: "ke lebohile haholo hore sekolo se hapile kgao," ho rialo seyanokeng sejake, eo a nang le dilemo tse 24 e le mosuwehlooho wa thabang primary.

column1: thabang primary school has been running its nutrition programme since 1994. today, it ensures that its 1 065 learners receive a healthy breakfast daily from a local business.
column2: sekolo sa thabang primary esale se tsamaisa lenaneo la sona la phepo e ntle ho tloha ka 1994. ha jwale, se netefatsa hore bana ba sona ba 1 065 ba fumana dijo tsa hoseng tse kwenneng letsatsi le letsatsi tse rekwang ho kgwebo ya lehae.

column1: the food is cooked by unemployed members of the community, who are appointed by the school governing body (sgb).
column2: dijo di phehwa ke ditho tsa setjhaba tse hlo kang mesebetsi, bao ba ileng ba hlwahwa ke lekgotla la tsamaiso ya sekolo (sgb).

column1: "our six employed voluntary food handlers (vfh) make the food provided by the department of basic education through the allocation of funds to the school," says sejake.
column2: "baithaupi ba rona ba tshelela ba hiruweng ba hlophisang dijo (vfh) ba pheha dijo tse fepelwang ke lefapha la thuto ka dikabelo tsa matlole ho sekolo," ho rialo sejake.

column1: they vfhs each receive a stipend for preparing the food.
column2: ka bong, divfh ba fumana meputso bakeng la ho hlophisa dijo.

column1: thabang primary school took top honours at the awards due to the hard work and commitment of its sgb, management team and functional nsnp com mittee, says sejake.
column2: sekolo sa thabang primary se hapile kgao e ka sehlohlolong dikgaong ka lebaka la ho sebetsa ka thata le boitelo ba sgb ya sona, sehlopha sa tsamaiso le komiti ya nsnp e sebetsang, ho rialo sejake.

column1: "punctuality is the order of the day.
column2: "ho fihla ka nako ke setlwaedi.

column1: we don’t allow absenteeism, without a valid reason, and we have no dropouts.
column2: ha re dumelle bolofa, ntle le lebaka le utlwahalang, mme ha re na baithuti ba tlohelang sekolo ba soka ba phethela dithuto tsa bona.

column1: our learners’ concentration and general performance have also improved," she adds.
column2: ho mamela ka hloko le ho sebetsa hantle ha baithuti ba rona mesebetsing ya bona kaofela ya sekolo di ntlafetse le tsona," o rialo.

column1: as the prize for winning the award is a stateoftheart kitchen built by the tiger brands foundation, the school’s nutrition programme is set to become even better.
column2: hobane moputso wa ho hapa kgao ke kitjhine ya majabajaba e hauweng ke tiger brands foundation, mme lenaneo la phepo e ntle la sekolo le tla ntlafala le ho feta.

column1: the school also ensures that there are enough food supplies which are managed properly, to ensure there is always food for the programme.
column2: sekolo sena se netefatsa hore ho na le phepelo e leka neng ya dijo e tla tsamaiswa hantle, ho netefatsa hore ho dula ho ena le dijo bakeng la lenaneo lena.

column1: "for example, we have a food garden that supplies vegetables to supplement the nsnp allocation," explains sejake.
column2: "ho etsa mohlala, re na le serapa sa dijo se fepelang meroho e tlatsele tsang dio tsa nsnp," ho hla losa sejake.

column1: award winners in the best schools category, grootdrink intermediate, in the mgcawu district in the northern cape, took second place and aaron gqedu primary school, in nelson mandela bay in the eastern cape, came third.
column2: bahlodi ba dikgao mokgahlelong wa dikolo tse hlwahlwa, grootdrink inte rmediate, se mane seterekeng sa mgcawu, kapa leboya, se nkile boemo ba bobedi; mme sekolo sa aaron gqedu primary, se nelson mandela bay mane kapa botjhabela, sa nka boemo ba boraro.

column1: they will receive kitchen equipment from the depart ment of basic education.
column2: di tla fumana disebediswa tsa kitjhine ho tswaho lefapha la thuto ya motheo.

column1: the best district award was won by umzinyathi (kwazulunatal).
column2: kgao ya setereke se hlwahlwa e hapuwe ke umzinyathi (kwazulunatal).

column1: the zf mgcawu district (northern cape) came second and metro north (western cape) came third.
column2: le setereke sa zf mgcawu (kapa leboya) se tswileng boemong ba bobedi le metro north (kapa bophirima) se boemong ba boraro.

column1: each district won office and computer equipment.
column2: setereke kang ka seng se hapile disebediswa tsa dikantorong le disebe diswa tsa dikhomphutha.

column1: in 2020/21, the nsnp provided meals to children at 21 189 schools.
column2: ka 2020/21, nsnp e ile ya fepela dijo ho bana ba dikolo tse 21 189.

column1: flood relief for kzn and e cape allison cooper government will help residents of kwazulunatal and the eastern cape rebuild their lives and homes after floods recently left a trail of death and destruction in the two provinces.
column2: dithuso tsa phallelo tsa dikgohola kzn le kapa botjhabela allison cooper mmuso o tla thusa baahi ba kwazulunatal (kzn) le kapa botjhabela ho aha maphelo le metse ya bona botjha ka mora hore dikgohola di siye mophula wa lefu le tshenyo diprofenseng tsena tse pedi.

column1: president cyril ramaphosa said national treasury will make money available for relief efforts to help those affected by the floods.
column2: mopresidente cyril ramaphosa o itse botshwari ba matlotlo ba naha bo tla fana ka tjhelete malebana le matsapa a dithuso tsa phallelo bakeng la ho thusa batho bao ba anngweng ke dikgohola tsena.

column1: "the minister of finance has said that r1 billion is immediately available," he said.
column2: "letona la ditjhelete le itse r1 bilione e tla fumaneha hanghang," ho rialo mopresidente.

column1: president ramaphosa will also approach parliament for additional resources.
column2: mopresidente ramaphosa o tla boela a buisana le palamente ho fumana mehlodi ya tlatsetso.

column1: government is working with the solidarity fund, private sector and nongovernmental and communitybased organisations to support victims.
column2: mmuso o sebetsa mmoho le letlole la mahatammoho, lekala la poraefete le mekgatlo eo e seng ya mmuso le mekgatlo ya setjhaba ho tshehetsa diphofu.

column1: the solidarity fund will set up a separate bank account for the flood disaster for south african and foreign donors to contribute to relief efforts.
column2: letlole la mahatammoho le tla bula akhaonto ya banka e ka thoko ya koduwa ya dikgohola eo ho yona bafani ba maafrika borwa le ba dinaha tse kantle ba tla kenya letsoho maitekong a dithuso tsa phallelo ena.

column1: government will also provide vouchers to help households rebuild partially damaged houses, the president said.
column2: mmuso o tla boela o fana ka divaotjhara ho thusa malapa ho aha botjha matlo a senyehileng hanyane, ho rialo mopresidente .

column1: "a comprehensive assessment of the economic cost of these floods still has to be made, but it is clear that it will run into billions of rands for the rebuilding of infrastructure and loss of production."
column2: "tlhahlobo e batsi ya ditjeho tsa moruo tse bakilweng ke dikgohola tsena e sa ntse e tla etswa, empa ho hlakile hore e tla qosa dibilione tsa diranta ba keng sa kahobotjha ya meralo ya motheo le bakeng la tahlehelo ya tlhahiso."

column1: he added that the money set aside for the flood victims must reach those who need it the most.
column2: o phaelletse ka hore tjhelete ena e behelletsweng ka thoko bakeng sa diphofu tsa dikgohola e tlameha ho finyella ho batho ba e hlokang ka ho fetisisa.

column1: "it will be critical, as we undertake this work, that all the re sources we mobilise are used for their intended purposes and reach the intended recipients.
column2: "ho tla ba bohlokwahlokwa, hore ha re etsa mosebetsi ona, mehlodi yohle eo re e bokellang e sebedisetswe merero eo e rere tsweng, mme e finyelle ho batho bao e ba tshwanelang.

column1: there can be no room for corruption, mismanagement or fraud of any sort," the president stressed.
column2: re ke ke ra mamella bobodu, taolo e mpe kapa boqhekanyetsi ba mofuta le ha e le ofe", mopresidente o tiiseditse setjhaba jwalo.

column1: threephased response president ramaphosa said government will respond to the disaster in three phases.
column2: karabelo ya mekgahlelo e meraro mopresidnte ramaphosa o itse mmuso o tla arabela koduwa ena ka mekgahlelo e meraro.

column1: it will first focus on immediate humanitarian relief, ensuring that everyone affected is safe and their basic needs are met.
column2: e tla qala ka ho tsepamisa maikutlo ho dithuso tsa phallelo tsa hanghang tsa setjhaba, ho netefatsa hore bohle ba amehileng o bolokehile, mme ditlhoko tsa bona tsa mantlha di a kgahlametswa.

column1: "second, we will focus on stabilisation and recovery, rehousing people who have lost homes and restoring the provision of services.
column2: "ntlheng ya bobedi, re tla tsepamisa maikutlo mosebetsing wa ho tsitsisa le ho tsosoloso ya maemo, le ho boela ho fumantshwa batho ba helehetsweng ke matlo bodulo le ho busetsa motjheng phano ya ditshebeletso.

column1: "third, we will focus on reconstruction and rebuilding," he said.
column2: ntlheng ya boraro, re tla tsitsisa maikutlo ho kahobotjha ya naha le ya matlo", o rialo.

column1: the reconstruction and building phase will include the construction of houses in suitable areas.
column2: mokgahlelo wa kahobotjha ya naha le ya matlo o tla kenyeletsa kaho ya matlo dibakeng tse tshwanelang.

column1: the department of human settlements has already begun an assessment of damages to houses across the province.
column2: lefapha la bodulo le se le ntse le qadile ho hlahloba tshenyo e etsahetseng matlong provenseng ka bophara.

column1: "an immediate task is to house those people who have been displaced by the floods and preparations are underway to provide temporary residential units," said president ramaphosa.
column2: "mosebetsi wa hanghang ke wa ho fumantsha batho ba qhalakantswe ng ke dikgohola bodulo, mme ditokisetso di ntse di etswa tsa hore ba fumantshwe matlo a bodulo ba nakwana", o boletse jwalo mopresi dente ramaphosa.

column1: the department of public works and infrastructure is identifying suitable state land that can be used for resettlement.
column2: lefapha la mesebetsi ya setjhaba le infrastraktjha le ntse hlwaya mobu wa mmuso o loketseng ho sebedisetswa dithuso tsa phallelo ya batho hore ho tle ho boele ho fumantshwe batho ba amehang mahae.

column1: extensive damage the rains caused extensive damage to houses; businesses; roads and bridges; water, electricity, rail and telecommunications infrastructure.
column2: tshenyehelo e kgolo dipula tsena di bakile tshenyo e kgolo matlong; dikgwebong; mebileng le maborokgong, motlaka seng, meralo ya motheo ya diporo tsa diterene le mehala ya dikgokahanyo.

column1: schools, health facilities, police stations and magistrates’ courts were also affected, along with fuel and food supplies.
column2: dikolo, dipetlele le ditliliniki, diteishene tsa sepolesa, makgotla a bommaseterata le ona a ile a ameha, mmoho le phepelo ya mafura le dijo.

column1: "it is estimated that over 270 000 learners were affected and over 600 schools were damaged, 16 of which cannot be accessed due to damage to connecting roads and bridges.
column2: ho lekanyetswa hore baithuti ba fetang 270 000 ba amehile, le dikolo tse ka hodimo ho 600 di se nyehile, moo tse 16 tsa tsona di sa fihlelleheng ka lebaka la tshenyo e etsahetseng mebileng le marokgong a hokelang batho le dikolo tsena.

column1: "sixtysix public healthcare facilities were affected, although there has been minimal disruption to health services in most affected districts," the president said.
column2: "ditsi tsa bophelo bo botle tse 66 di amehile, le ha ho mpa ho bile le tshitiso e seng kae feela ditshebeletsong tsa bophelo bo botle ho boholo ba ditereke tse amehileng", ho rialo mopre sidente.

column1: extensive work is under way to restore basic services to various areas in kzn.
column2: mosebetsi o moholo o se o ntse o etsuwa ho busetsa tshebetsong ditshebeletso tsa mantlha dibakeng tse fapafapaneng tsa kzn.

column1: more than 400 people have lost their lives in kzn and many people are missing.
column2: batho ba fetang 400 ba lahlehetswe ke maphelo a bona kzn, mme batho ba bangata ba nyametse.

column1: one death has also been reported in the eastern cape.
column2: ho boetse ho tlalehilwe lefu la motho ya le mong profenseng ya kapa botjhabela.

column1: over 4 000 homes have been destroyed and 8 300 have been partially damaged, leaving 40 000 people homeless.
column2: mahae a fetang 4 000 a helehile mme a 8 300 ona a senyehile hanyenyane, sena se entse hore batho ba 40 000 ba sale lepalapaleng.

column1: the president said that the south african police service (saps) and the south african national defence force (sandf) have been leading search and rescue efforts.
column2: mopresidente o itse sepolesa sa afrika borwa (saps) le lebotho la naha la tshireletso la afrika borwa (sandf) e bile tsona tse etellang pele matsapa a ho batla le ho pholosa diphofu.

column1: this includes the deployment of saps personnel, diving teams, canine units and various vessels, helicopters and fixedwing planes to the most affected areas.
column2: matsapa ana a kenyeleditse ho romelwa ha basebeletsi ba saps, dihlopha tsa baqwedi, makala a dintja le diketswana tse fapafapaneng, dirwalankgwana le difofane tsa mapheo a tsitsitseng ho ya dibakeng tse amehileng ka ho fetisisa.

column1: "aircraft from the sandf have been used both for rescue and for the delivery of relief supplies – such as food, water, tents and blankets – to people in inaccessible areas.
column2: "difofane tse tswang ho sandf di ile tsa sebedisetswa ho pholosa diphofu le tsamaisong ya diphepelo tsa dithuso tsa phallelo– tse kang dijo, metsi, ditente le dikobo – ho ya bathong ba dibakeng tse sa fihlelleheng ha bonolo.

column1: "i have authorised the sandf to bring in more personnel, water storage and purification supplies and engineering teams to assist with electricity and water restoration," he said government departments at national and provincial levels; municipalities; nongovernmental organisations and businesses have been distributing basic relief materials such as food, blankets, mattresses, clothing, chronic medication, toiletries and cooking utensils.
column2: "ke file sandf matla a ho eketsa masole, phepelo ya ditshelo tsa metsi le ya tlhwekiso ya ona, mmoho le dihlopha tsa diinjinere ho ya thusa ka ho tsosolosa phepelo ya motlakase le ya metsi," o rialo.

column1: cabinet recently declared a national state of disaster in response to floods.
column2: mafapha a mmuso boemong ba naha le ba diprovense; dimmasepala; mekgatlo eo e seng ya mmuso le dikgwebo, haesale di ntse di aba disebediswa tsa mantlha tsa dithuso tsa phallelo tse kang dijo, dikobo, dimaterase, diaparo, meriana ya mafu a sa foleng, dintho tsa ho hlapa le disebediswa tsa ho pheha.

column1: the president described the floods as a humanitarian disaster that called for a "massive and urgent relief effort.
column2: kabinete e sa tswa phatlalatsa boemo ba naha ba koduwa ho kgahlametsana le dikgohola.

column1: ""the lives, h ealth and wellbeing of thousands of people are still at risk.
column2: mopresidente o hlalositse ha dikgohola tsena e le koduwa ya setjhaba e qositseng hore ho be le matsapa "a maholo le a potlakileng a dithuso tsa phallelo.

column1: the floods have caused great economic and social damage," he said.
column2: ""maphelo, bophelo bo botle le boiphediso ba diketekete tsa batho di kotsing.

column1: the port of durban, which is vital to south africa’s economy and is one of the largest and busiest shipping terminals on the continent, has been severely affected.
column2: dikgohola tsena di bakile tshenyo e kgolo ya moruo le ya maemo a bophelo ba batho," o rialolediboho la thekong, leo e leng la bohlokwahlokwa moruong wa afrika borwa, leo e leng boemakepe bo boholo ka ho fetisisa, hape bo phathahaneng ka ho fetisisa kontinenteng ena, le amehile haholo.

column1: "the significance of the port of durban and rela ted infrastructure for the effective operation of the country’s economy means that this disaster has implications far beyond kzn," said the president.
column2: "bohlokwa ba lediboho la thekong le meralo ya motheo e amanang le lona bakeng la tshebetso e sebetsang hantle ya moruo wa naha bo bolela hore koduwa ena e na le ditlamorao tse fihlellang kantle ho meedi ya kzn," ho boletese mopresidente.

column1: progress has already been made in restoring operations at the port of durban, opening alternative routes for trucks to access the port terminals and clean up debris in the harbour.
column2: tswelopele e se e entswe ho busetsa tshebetso setlwaeding ledibohong la thekong, ka ho bula ditsela tse ding tsa dilori hore di fihlelle boemakepe ba lediboho, di tsebe ho thotha malwanlwahla a boemakepeng bona.

column1: south africa’s first veterinary nurses graduate allison cooper being one of the country’s first veterinary nurse graduates is a dream come true for randburg resident phumelela mthimkhulu (21), who has been passionate about animals since she was a child.
column2: baoki ba pele ba diphoofolo ba afrika borwa ba fumana mangolo a thuto allison cooper ho ba dirutehi tsa ho qala ho ba baoki ba diphoofolo ke toro e phethahetseng bakeng sa modudi wa randburg phumelela mthimkhulu (21), eo esale a na le lerato la diphoofolo ho tloha bongwaneng.

column1: mthimkhulu recently graduated from the university of pretoria (up), the only veterinary training facility in sa, with a bachelor of veterinary nursing degree.
column2: mthimkhulu haufinyana tjena o fumane mangolo a thuto yunivesithing ya pre toria (up), e leng sona feela setheo sa thupello ya bo ngaka ba diphoofolo afrika borwa, ka lengolo la kgerata ya bachelor of veterinary nursing.

column1: "it’s crazy to wrap my head around.
column2: "ke ntse ke sa kgolwe hore ke nna enwa.

column1: to know that i was part of the first class to do the bachelor’s degree, which has been years in the making, is an honour.
column2: ho tseba hore ke ne ke le karolo ya sehlopha sa pele sa ho etsa lengolo lena, e leng se nkukileng dilemo, ke tlotla.

column1: "i’m grateful for the opportunities and doors that will open for us nurses to further our studies and specialise within our profession, which was hard to do in the past," she says.
column2: "ke lebohela menyetla le mamati a tla buleha bakeng sa rona baoki hore re ntshe tse dithuto tsa rona pele le ho ipabola ka hara lekala la rona, e leng se neng se le boima ho se etsa nakong e fetileng," o rialo.

column1: tamarin fisher, the pre sident of the veterinary nurses association of south africa, says this is the biggest milestone in the profession’s 42year history.
column2: tamarin fisher, e leng moporesidente wa mokgatlo wa baoki ba diphoofolo wa afrika borwa, o re ona ke mokolokotwane o moholo ka ho fetisisa nalaneng ya dilemo tse 42 lekaleng lena.

column1: "the new threeyear degree will give qualified nurses the opportunity to enrol in postgraduate studies, which will hopefully culminate in the awarding of masters and phd degrees."
column2: "lengolo lena le letjha la dilemo tse tharo le tla neha baoki ba nang le mangolo monyetla wa ho ingodisetsa dithuto tsa kamora dikgerata, moo re tshepang hore ba tla qetella ba fumane mangolo a honours, masters le a bongaka (phd)."

column1: veterinarians treat animals’ injuries and illnesses, similar to how a doctor provides health treatment for people.
column2: baalafi ba diphoofolo ba alafa maqeba a diphoofolo le mahloko, ho tshwana feela jwaloka ha ngaka e fana ka kalafo ya bophelo bo botle bathong.

column1: veterinary nurses are essential in vets’ professional teams, says mthimkhulu.
column2: baoki ba diphoofolo ba bohlokwa dihlopheng tsa seporofeshenale tsa dingaka tsa diphoofolo, ho rialo mthimkhulu.

column1: "some of the vital skills a nurse has to display are patient care, client communication, assisting veterinarians with procedures, and anything that will help the veterinary hospital to function at its best.
column2: "a mang a maitsebelo a bohlokwa ao mooki a lokelang ho a bontsha ke tlhokomelo ya bakudi, ho buisana le ditlelaente, ho thusa dingaka tsa diphoofolo ka ditsamaiso, le ntho e nngwe le e nngwe e tla thusa sepetlele sa diphoofolo ho sebetsa ka tsela e hlwahlwa ka ho fetisisa.

column1: "it’s one of the most rewarding professions.
column2: "ke le leng la makala a putsang ka ho fetisisa.

column1: if you want to be a veterinary nurse, don’t allow fear or a lack of knowledge to deter you from trying it out and enjoying it because it will change your life for the better," says mthimkhulu.
column2: haeba o batla ho ba mooki wa diphoofolo, o se ke wa dumella tshabo kapa kgaello ya tsebo ho o thibela ho le leka le ho le thabela hobane le tla fetola bophelo ba hao hore e be bo betere," ho rialo mthimkhulu.

column1: bursaries to address skills shortagedue to a severe skills shortage in the sector, mthimkhulu didn’t battle to find a job.
column2: dibasari bakeng sa ho tobana le kgaello ya maitsebeloka lebaka la kgaello e kgolo ya maitsebelo lekaleng lena, mthimkhulu ha a ka a sokola ho fumana mosebetsi.

column1: "i was lucky enough to secure a job at fourways veterinary hospital during my final year.
column2: "ke bile lehlohonolo haholo hore ke fumane mosebetsi sepetlele sa diphoofolo sa fourways selemong sa ka sa ho qetela.

column1: i started working there about a month after my final exams and i’ve been enjoying every moment of it," she says.
column2: ke qadile ho sebetsa moo ntho e ka etsang kgwedi kamora ditlhahlobo tsa makgaolakgang mme esale ke thabela motsotso o mong le o mong," o rialo.

column1: the health and welfare sector education and training authority (hwseta) is committed to addressing the extreme skills shortage in the veterinary sector and ensuring transformation.
column2: bolaodi ba lekala la thuto le thupello la kalafo le thekolohelo (hwseta) le itlametse ho tobana le kgaello ya maitsebelo e fetelletseng ka hara lekala la kalafo ya diphoofolo le ho netefatsa diphethoho.

column1: it recently launched a veterinary science career guidance campaign, in partnership with the department of higher education and training, and will be visiting rural schools to encourage learners to consider veterinary services as a career path.
column2: haufinyana tjena bo tha kgotse letsholo la tataiso ya lekala la saense ya kalafo ya diphoofolo, ka semphato le lefapha la thuto le thupello e phahameng, mme bo tla etela dikolo tsa metseng ya mahae ho kgothaletsa baithuti ho nahana ka ditshebeletso tsa kalafo ya diphoofolo jwaloka motjha wa mosebetsi.

column1: it also announced 60 bursaries to address the critical shortage of veterinarians and paraveterinarians in south africa’s rural areas.
column2: bo boetse bo tsebisitse dibasari tse 60 bakeng sa ho tobana le kgaello e hlokolosi ya dingaka tsa diphoofolo le bathusi ba dingaka tsa diphoofolo dibakeng tsa mahae tsa afrika borwa.

column1: "the bursaries are specifically aimed at learners in rural areas as they can take their knowledge back to their homesteads," says dr nomfundo mnisi, the chairperson of the hwseta.
column2: "dibasari di reretswe ka ho toba baithuti ba dibakeng tsa metse ya mahae kaha ba ka busetsa tsebo ya bona metseng ya bo bona," ho rialo ngaka nomfundo mnisi, e leng modulasetulo wa hwseta.

column1: the deputy minister of higher education, science and innovation, buti manamela, welcomed the bursaries.
column2: motlatsi wa letona la thuto e phahameng, saense le ntjhafatso, buti manamela, o amohetse dibasari tsena.

column1: the up’s faculty of vete rinary science will assist the hwseta in its marketing, bursary funding and recruitment campaigns.
column2: lefapha la up la saense ya bongaka ba diphoofolo le tla thusa hwseta ka matsholo a ho ibapatsa, a matlole a dibasari le a ho thaotha.

column1: "we will also assist the hwseta in administering the bursaries, which were allocated for firstyear veterinary science stu dents from the designated groups," says chris van blerk, the head of communications and media at up’s faculty of veterinary science.
column2: "re tla boela re thuse hwseta mabapi le ho tsamaisa dibasari, tse neng di abetswe baithuti ba selemo sa pele sa saense ya kalafo ya diphoofolo ho tswa dihlopheng tse hlokang menyetla," ho rialo chris van blerk, hlooho ya dikgokahanyo le merero ya boraditaba lefapheng la saense ya kalafo ya diphoofolo la up.

column1: he says youth hoping to follow in mthimkhulu’s footsteps and register for a first bachelor’s degree at up need to have completed their national senior certificate (nsc), or equivalent qualification, and meet minimum requirements.
column2: o re batjha ba lakatsang ho latela menyabuketsong ya mthimkhulu le ho ingodisa bakeng sa lengolo la pele la dikgerata up ba lokela hore ba be ba phethetse setifikeiti se phahameng sa naha (nsc), kapa lengolo le tshwanang le lona, le ho kgema le ditlhokeho tsa mantlha.

column1: "for the bachelor of veterinary nursing degree, they need a minimum admission point score of 28 and an nsc with english home language or english first additional language, mathematics, and physical sciences or life sciences," he adds.
column2: "bakeng sa kgerata ya booki ba diphoofolo, ba lokela ho kgema le seahlolo sa dintlha tsa kamohelo sa 28 le nsc ka senyesemane e le puo ya lapeng kapa senyesemane e le puo ya pele ya tlatsetso, mmetse, le saense kapa disaense tsa bophelo," o a tlatseletsa.

column1: for more information about the sector, youth can contact private vete rinary practices or speak to compulsory community service (ccs) veterinarians which are part of the department of agriculture, land reform and rural development (dalrrd) around the country.
column2: bakeng sa tlhahisoleseding e eketsehileng ka lekala lena, batjha ba ka iteanya le dibaka tsa bongaka ba diphoofolo kapa ba ka bua le baalafi ba diphoofolo ba tshebeletso e tlamang ya badudi (ccs) bao e leng karolo ya lefapha la temothuo, tlhabollo ya mobu le ntshetsopele ya dibaka tsa mahae (dalrrd) ho phatlalla le naha.

column1: "the ccs programme aims to provide accessible and affordable veterinary services to underserved and poor resourced areas within south africa.
column2: "lenaneo la ccs le rerile ho fana ka ditshebeletso tse fihlellehang le tse kgonehang tsa bongaka ba diphoofolo dibakeng tse sa fumaneng ditshebeletso tse batlehang le ho haella ka mehlodi ka hara afrika borwa.

column1: as such, vets in the programme will always serve as good information resources," says van blerk.
column2: kahoo, dingaka tsa diphoofolo tsa lenaneo di tla dula di sebetsa jwaloka mehlodi e hlwahlwa ya tlhahisoleseding," ho rialo van blerk.

column1: collect your driver's licence card vukuzenzele unnamed motorists who applied for a new or renewal driver’s licence card or professional driving permit (prdp) between october and december last year are being urged to collect them.
column2: lata karete ya hao ya laesense ya ho kganna vukuzenzele unnamed bakganni ba entseng dikopo tsa dilaesense tsa ho kganna kapa ho ntjhafatsa dikarete kapa diphomete tsa seporofeshenale tsa ho kganna (prdp) pakeng tsa mphalane le tshitwe ngwahola ba kgothaletswa ho ya di lata.

column1: according to the road traffic management corporation (rtmc), only 42% of the 32 748 driver’s licence cards produced during this time have been collected.
column2: ho ya ka koporasi ya bolaodi ba sephethephethe mebileng (rtmc), ke feela 42% ya dikarete tsa dilaesense tsa ho kganna tse 32 748 tse hlahisitsweng nakong ena tse latuweng.

column1: minister of transport fikile mbalula opened the rtmc licensing centres in midrand and eco park last year, in response to the backlog of expired driver’s licences due to covid19.
column2: letona la dipalangwang fikile mbalula le butse ditsi tsa phano ya dilaesense tsa rtmc midrand le eco park ngwahola, e le karabelo ya tshallomorao ya dilaesense tsa ho kganna tse felletsweng ke nako ka lebaka la covid19.

column1: the driver’s licence card account, which prints the licences, is working around the clock to fasttrack production and remains on course to clear the backlog by the end of june.
column2: akhaonte ya dikarete tsa dilaesense tsa ho kganna, e hatisang dilaesense, e sebetsa bosiu le motsheare ho akofisa tlhahiso mme e ntse e le motjheng wa ho fedisa tshallomorao mafelong a phuptjane.

column1: the rtmc says people can check the status of their application before going to the testing centre to collect it.
column2: rtmc e re batho ba lokela ho lekola boemo ba dikopo tsa bona pele ba leba ditsing tsa diteko ba ilo di lata.

column1: this can be done by sms or online.
column2: sena se ka etswa ka sms kapa ka inthanete.

column1: driver’s licence sms query for a driver’s licence query, applicants can sms their id number to 33214. they will then receive one of the smses below: application received: the application was received, but has not yet been processed.
column2: ho lekola ka sms boemo ba dikopo tsa bona tsa dilaesense tsa ho kganna bakeng sa bothata ba dilaesense tsa ho kganna, baikopedi ba ka romela dinomoro tsa bona tsa id ka sms ho 33214. ebe ba tla fumana e nngwe ya disms tse ka tlase mona: application received: the application was received, but has not yet been processed.

column1: production queue: the card is still being processed and manufactured.
column2: production queue: the card is still being processed and manufactured.

column1: produced and ready for collection: the card will be ready for collection in 21 days.
column2: produced and ready for collection: the card will be ready for collection in 21 days.

column2: however, due to the high number of cards being processed, the rtmc advises you to wait 35 days before going to collect.

column2: problem card: there is a problem with the production of your card.

column2: please return to the testing centre.

column1: those whose licences expired between march 2020 and 31 august 2021, who missed the renewal deadline of 5 may, are advised to obtain a tempo rary driver’s licence when applying for their renewal to remain legally compliant.
column2: bao dilaesense tsa bona di felletsweng ke nako pakeng tsa tlhakubele 2020 le 31 phato 2021, ba tlotsweng ke letsatsi la ho qetela la ho ntjhafatsa la 5 motsheanong, ba eletswa ho iphumanela laesense ya ho kganna ya nakwana ha ba etsa kopo ya ho ntjhafatsa bakeng sa ho dula ba ntse ba imatahantse le molao.

column1: while rtmc centres are open monday to sunday from 7am to 9pm, members of the public are encouraged to take advantage of shorter queues on fridays and the weekend.
column2: leha ditsi tsa rtmc di butswe mantaha ho isa sontaha ho tloha ka hora ya bosupa hoseng ho fihlela ka hora ya borobong bosiu, setjhaba se kgothaletswa ho nka monyetla wa mela e mekgutshwane ka bolabohlano le mafelong a beke.
